info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:54PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN CATRON COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 254 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Pleasanton, or 22 miles northwest of Buckhorn. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Catron County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
